place.name: ABENHALL
place.gazetteerText: ABINGHALL, or Abbenhall, a parish in Westbury on-Severn district, Gloucester; in Dean forest, 1¾ mile SSW of Longhope r. station, and 5 N of Newnham. Post Town, Longhope under Newnham. Acres, 751. Real property, £1,718. Pop., 228. Houses, 48. The property is not much divided. There is a mineral spring. The living is a rectory in the diocese of Gloucester and Bristol. Value, £142.* Patron, J. F. Sevier, Esq. The church is an old Norman edifice, in good condition and contains some ancient tombs. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
